item.title: The Finals Makes Major Announcement Ahead of Season 6
item.description:
Summary

  • Embark Studios announces $100,000 Major for​ The Finals​ in Q4 2025.
  • Season 6 will add new features to support high-level competition, such as an upgraded spectator mode and new ranked tournament privacy settings.
  • More details on The Finals' venture into the world of esports are still to come.

The Finals developer Embark Studios has announced its first venture into the world of esports, officially confirming a $100,000 Major for Q4 2025. Fans of The Finals are patiently waiting for news on the game's highly anticipated Season 6 update, which should be launching sometime in March. However, those looking to put their skills to the test will be able to jump into the shooter's very first esports tournament later this year.

Although there has yet to be an official announcement from Embark Studios, the in-game countdown states that Season 6 will be launching later this month. With only a couple of weeks left to go, teases for The Finals Season 6 have already begun. Back in February, the developer posted a cryptic video that, while revealing very little, was likely the first teaser for the game's upcoming season. In a recent Reddit AMA, Embark Studios also responded to fans who were continuously requesting a medieval-style map be added to the game. In response, the developers said they would love to bring such a map to The Finals ​​​​​, especially because of Sweden's history.

The Finals Announces 2025 Major Tournament

While there is still no official news surrounding The Finals ' next major content update, Embark Studios has revealed the game's first Major tournament for 2025. In a new blog post, Embark Studios' Community Lead, Oscar Lundberg, officially announced that The Finals is "on the road to esports." The Major 2025 tournament will take place in Q4 2025 with a massive $100,000 up for grabs. The studio confirmed that there will be an in-person LAN event and open qualifiers, meaning anyone can jump in and put their skills to the test. While there are still plenty more details to be revealed, Embark did reveal that some important preparations are underway to ensure The Finals is ready to support high-level competition.

Esports in video games continue to grow each year, with The Finals becoming the latest shooter to venture into the competitive scene. To prepare for the Major 2025 tournament, The Finals has confirmed that Season 6 will feature various new features and improvements. First of all, fans can expect to find enhanced private match experiences, with "more control" for players and organizers. Season 6 will also feature an upgraded spectator mode to allow for a better viewing experience for fans and analysts. Finally, there will be new ranked tournament privacy settings for UI and HUD adjustments to make matches fairer and more balanced.

Embark says there are more updates still to come, as this is "just the beginning" for the game's competitive format. Despite the fact that 2024 was a rough year for The Finals , with its player count dropping dramatically on Steam, that clearly hasn't prevented Embark Studios from going all out with its new esports venture. Parent company Nexon also said in May 2024 that The Finals ​​​​​​had fallen short of its expectations. Although the title has been reviewed positively by fans and critics, the shooter appears to be struggling when it comes to player retention. Hopefully, with a new venture into the world of esports, The Finals could see a much-needed boost in players.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: How to Change Your (& Your Palico's) Voice
item.description:
When you start a new game in Monster Hunter Wilds , you'll be greeted with an in-depth character creator that lets you customize every single detail of your Hunter and Palico . You can tweak pretty much everything you want, starting from the looks of your Hunter right down to how they sound or run.

If you rushed through character creation, you might be surprised to hear your Palico speaking like a human. For those used to the classic Felyne chatter from past Monster Hunter games, this might be a bit unsettling. Luckily, it's not too late to change it your Palico's voice , and while you're at it, you can also fine-tune your Hunter's voice as well.

How to Change Your Hunter's Voice in Monster Hunter Wilds

The simplest way to change your Hunter's voice in Monster Hunter Wilds is during character creation before you start the game. However, if you missed that option or later decide you want a different voice, you can still change it at any time from your Player Tent at camp.

Head inside the tent and navigate to the Appearance Menu. From here, select Change Appearance, which will take you back to the character creator. Select the Hunter option to access the player's character creation window. The Voice Pitch option near the bottom lets you choose from 20 different pitches, allowing you to fine-tune your Hunter's voice to match their personality.

You can also select the Equipment Appearance option from the Appearance Menu to hide your Helmet or other pieces of armor if you want.

How to Change Your Palico's Voice in Monster Hunter Wilds

Your Palico's voice can be changed from the same character creation menu you accessed through the Player Tent. Similar to the Hunter's settings, there are 20 different voice pitch options to choose from for your Palico.

Most importantly, you'll also find a Felyne Language toggle in this menu. According to Monster Hunter lore, Palicos are capable of speaking in human language, but if you find it unsettling, you can switch it off to make them speak in their traditional Felyne language.

Unlike some RPGs that lock in character customization after you start the game, Monster Hunter Wilds gives you the freedom to tweak your Hunter and Palico whenever you want. Whether you rushed through the character creator or simply want to experiment with different voices and styles, you can always head back to your tent and make adjustments on the fly.

How to Redeem Codes in Fruit Battlegrounds

Players should follow the few steps mentioned below and claim codes for free:

  1. Open Roblox and launch Fruit Battlegrounds
  2. Choose the option Spin Fruit to enter the store.
  3. Click on the chest.
  4. In the screen’s bottom-left corner, you can see the special window for redeeming codes.
  5. Paste the code here and click the Redeem button. Codes will automatically store rewards on the account.

Fruit Battlegrounds Tips & Tricks

Spin Wisely

Players should use gems to spin for fruits and take advantage of the codes provided above to increase their gems count. They'll also want to save and equip rare or legendary fruits for better gameplay.

Use Feature

After 100 spins, players will be guaranteed good fruit. As such, they should keep spinning to make the most of this feature.

Level up efficiently

Using moves repeatedly will lead to them leveling up. Players can either fight other players or use their moves strategically to gain experience points.

Daily rewards

Players should log in daily to collect gems from the daily rewards feature.

Best Roblox Adventure Games Like Fruit Battlegrounds

Eventually, all games get boring or run out of content. In this case, finding new games is a necessity. Therefore, if players want a similar gaming experience, they can find five games like Fruit Battlegrounds listed below:

  • Dragon Race
  • Your Bizarre Adventure
  • Dragon Blox
  • Dragon Warrior Simulator
  • Dragons' Life

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: How To Get Money (Zenny) Fast
item.description:
Monster Hunter Wilds is the latest installment in the Monster Hunter franchise, bringing new monsters for players to defeat and more for players to explore. The game has many locations for players to explore as well as quests to complete. Players will also be able to customize their character, which includes their hair, face, and their outfit.

Players will be able to purchase armor and even make upgrades to it, but for some things, you will need money. This guide will go over how to make money in Monster Hunter Wilds and what players can use their money on.

How to Get Money (Zenny) Fast

Money in Monster Hunter's world is called Zenny . Players will need it to upgrade their armor and weapons, as well as purchase items for themselves and also their Palico. Learning how to earn Zenny fast is important, not only to get powerful quickly, but also to do some pretty cool things in the game.

Players will find themselves in many missions and quests that will require them to defeat monsters to complete them. Upon killing monsters, they will be able to gut them and collect materials from them which can then be sold at the end of the battle. Zenny is the easiest to obtain through defeating large monsters, which provide a higher amount of Zenny than smaller monsters do.

Players can use Zenny to purchase clothing, armor, weapons, food, and anything in the game that you might need. This is the only main currency that players use within the game in Monster Hunter Wilds .

Players will automatically get some Zenny from doing missions, which helps them come in contact with more monsters that will need defeating. Players can also leave their base and go out looking for some monsters to defeat, or join friends to help them complete their missions within their game to earn up some things to sell for currency. As you can see, there are many different ways to get money and the possibilities are endless.

item.title: Pirate Yakuza In Hawaii's Most Brilliant Cameo Explained
item.description:
Like a Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii sees protagonist Goro Majima interacting with a mix of new characters and returning faces from throughout the Yakuza series. The new characters are extremely memorable and compelling, from the young boy Noah to Masaru the cook who seeks love, and especially Goro the tiger cub. But one new Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii character, Teruhiko Shigaki, is particularly fun due to his status as a sneaky cameo that perfectly suits Majima's first solo starring role.

Teruhiko Shigaki's Connection To Majima Explained

Teruhiko Shigaki is an ex-yakuza who is introduced fairly early on in Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii. Like Majima himself, he is a former yakuza who came to Nele Island to help clean up the radioactive materials left behind due to the actions of Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth's Palekana cult. He looks up to Majima, who initially does not remember him due to his amnesia, but the two characters eventually come into conflict because Shigaki is interested in claiming the same treasure Majima is seeking.

In Japanese, Shigaki is voiced by Munetaka Aoki, and his appearance is also modeled after Aoki's. Aoki is a well-known film and TV actor who has appeared in Godzilla Minus One, Rurouni Kenshin, The Decagon House Murders, and many other roles. In 2024, he played none other than Goro Majima himself in Amazon's live-action Like a Dragon: Yakuza , which drew inspiration from both the original Yakuza game and its 2016 remake Yakuza Kiwami.

Shigaki Serves As A Fascinating Foil To Majima

The inclusion of Aoki in Pirate Yakuza following his on-screen portrayal of the Mad Dog of Shimano is more than just a fun cameo - it further emphasizes Shigaki's status as a foil to Majima. Like Majima, Shigaki is an ex-yakuza who is skilled in combat and cares for his subordinates. Shigaki mentions that he idolizes Majima, and sees his "Mad Dog" image as a role model for the kind of yakuza that he wanted to be.

However, they are also quite different - Shigaki firmly believes that ex-yakuza will never be able to successfully re-integrate into society, and thus seeks the Treasure of the Esperanza for monetary reasons, as he is convinced it will allow him and his fellow ex-yakuza to live the comfortable lives "normal" society will never allow them to have. This is in contrast to Majima's genuinely selfless motive: he wants the treasure to heal Noah's asthma.

In many ways, Shigaki is reminiscent of Majima prior to the character development the latter experiences throughout the Yakuza series and particularly in Pirate Yakuza. Late in the game, he kidnaps Noah in order to force Majima's hand - a move reminiscent of Majima once kidnapping Haruka Sawamura in one of his many bids to get Kazuma Kiryu to fight him. The conflict between the two ultimately highlights how far Majima has come since he was simply the man who would do anything for a fight, with the Goromaru's captain prioritizing the safety of his crew and his new friend at every turn.

At the end of the game, Shigaki is left questioning his own beliefs and ideals following his experience with Majima - perhaps hinting that he, much like Majima himself, may return in future Yakuza titles as a changed man. The casting of Munetaka Aoki, who has portrayed Majima in his full "Mad Dog" Yakuza and Kiwami glory, as Shigaki was an extremely effective choice that further highlights the fact that the two characters serve as foils to one another. Hopefully, fans will get to see more of Aoki as Shigaki as the series continues - perhaps journeying from antagonist to ally and truly following the path of his idol Goro Majima.
